Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Hip Resurfacing and Large-Head Total Hip Arthroplasty in Young and Active Patients with Hip Osteoarthritis

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either HR or large-head THA.

Participants.evidence: 48 patients with hip osteoarthritis, eligible based on age and activity level, at a single orthopedic center.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either HR or large-head THA.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to compare HR with large-diameter femoral head THA.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was gait speed, measured preoperatively and at 3, 6, and 12 months postoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding included patients, clinicians, and outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Forty-eight patients were randomised: 24 to HR and 24 to large-head THA.

Number_Analysed.evidence: All participants were analysed using an intention-to-treat approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Gait speed and postural balance evaluations, functional tests, and clinical scores were similar between HR and large-head THA groups at all follow-up periods.

Harms.evidence: No significant differences in adverse events were reported between groups.
